titleStmt.title: An account of several passages and letters between His Excellency Benjamin Fletcher, captain general and governour in chief of the province of New-York, province of Pennsilvania, county of New-Castle, &c. commissionated by Their Majesties under the Great Seal of England, to be their lieut. and commander in chief of the militia, and of all forces by sea and land within Their Majesties collony of Connecticut, and of all forts and places of strength within the same. And the present administrators of the laws in the collony of Connecticut, in the month of October, 1693
titleStmt.author: New York (State). Governor (1692-1698 : Fletcher)
Fletcher, Benjamin, 1640-1703.
Treat, Robert, ca. 1622-1710.
Connecticut. General Assembly.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and sold by William Bradford, printer to Their Majesties, King William and Queen Mary, at the Bible in New-York,

notesStmt.note: Concerning Gov. Fletcher's attempt to assume control of the Connecticut militia, and Connecticut's resistance thereto.
"A true copy, examined and allowed to be printed, by M. Clarkson, secretary."--p. 8.
Reproduction of original in the John Carter Brown Library.
